bibl.title: Coptic and Greek Texts Relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo.
bibl.note: P. Mon. Apa Apollo 1-66. - Part I: Discussion (1. Background to the selection of the texts; - 2. Sources for the texts; - 3. Findings from the texts; - 4. Description of the texts). - Part II: The texts [1-66, 6th-9th cent.]. - Appendices. Concordances. Corrigenda. Papyri, ostraca, and inscriptions discussed. Glossary. References. Indexes.
bibl.seg: CLACKSON Sarah J., Coptic and Greek Texts Relating to the Hermopolite Monastery of Apa Apollo.
Oxford, Griffith Institute - Ashmolean Museum, 2000, 4°, xvi-187 pp., tabl., 1 carte et 48 pll. ISBN 0-900416-75-0. £60.

P. Mon. Apa Apollo 1-66. - Part I: Discussion (1. Background to the selection of the texts; - 2. Sources for the texts; - 3. Findings from the texts; - 4. Description of the texts). - Part II: The texts [1-66, 6th-9th cent.]. - Appendices. Concordances. Corrigenda. Papyri, ostraca, and inscriptions discussed. Glossary. References. Indexes.

C.R. par Anna Di Bitonto Kasser, Aegyptus 80 (2000 [2002]) pp. 302-306. - Tomasz Markiewicz, JJurP 31 (2001) pp. 294-298. - Dominic Montserrat, JEA 87 (2001) pp. 200-202. - Hans Förster, Tyche 18 (2003) pp. 262-264. - Martin Krause, ArchPF 49 (2003) pp. 124-126. - Gonnie van den Berg-Onstwedder, BibO 59 (2002) coll. 552-554. - Terry G. Wilfong, BASP 40 (2003) pp. 237-239. - Tonio Sebastian Richter, OLZ 99 (2004) coll. 168-179. - Tonio Sebastian Richter, OLZ 99 (2004) coll. 168-179.
